Products in this release:
* Mylyn Commons: 3.10 * Mylyn Context: 3.10 * Mylyn Tasks: 3.10 * Mylyn Incubator: 3.10 * Mylyn Builds: 1.2 * Mylyn Docs: 1.9.0 * Mylyn Reviews: 2.1 * Mylyn Versions: 1.2

Chris mentioned that we should do new style release review using the Portal instead of submitting power point slides: http://wiki.eclipse.org/Project_Management_Infrastructure/Project_Metadata#Releases

Products in this release:
* Mylyn Commons: 3.10 * Mylyn Context: 3.10 * Mylyn Tasks: 3.10 * Mylyn Incubator: 3.10 * Mylyn Builds: 1.2 * Mylyn Docs: 1.9.0 * Mylyn Reviews: 2.1 * Mylyn Reviews: 2.0.1 * Mylyn Versions: 1.2

(In reply to comment #3) > Products in this release: > > * Mylyn Reviews: 2.0.1
I believe 2.0.1 is scheduled to be included in 3.9.1. Any reason 3.10 wouldn't include 2.1?
Nope. Ignore these comments. I just want to be able to plan my sprints without having a separate plan for the SR.

As discussed on today's call we are tentatively targeting early November 2013 as a release time frame. I'll set November 6 as a tentative release date in the portal and Mylyn calendar for now but we'll likely iterate over the plan again.

I have updated the review documentation under: https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/mylyn/releases/3.10 .
We'll need to do the following:
1) Create release branch for 3.10.x 2) Request a mylyn-3.10.x-release job on Hudson 3) Submit IP log for review 4) Seek PMC approval for release (documentation) 5) Schedule release review 6) Create New and Noteworthy 7) Tag and release

(In reply to comment #7) > 1) Create release branch for 3.10.x
I'll do that today after the IP log has been submitted.
> 2) Request a mylyn-3.10.x-release job on Hudson
Sam, Tomek, can you do that by filing a bug under Community/Hudson? Please ask for a clone of the mylyn-release job so we can reuse the existing configuration.
> 3) Submit IP log for review
I'll do that today.
> 4) Seek PMC approval for release (documentation)
Sam, can you please send an email to mylyn-pmc@eclipse.org to do that?
> 5) Schedule release review
We'll do that next week once the IP log has been approved. The current plan is to schedule for Oct 30 which gives us some room to slip to Nov 6.
> 6) Create New and Noteworthy
Sam, Tomek, we should have that ready a few days before the release date. The earlier the better so we can gather community feedback.
> 7) Tag and release
I'll do a "final" build today and tag shortly before the release since in case we decide to rebuild.

(In reply to Steffen Pingel from comment #7) > I have updated the review documentation under: > https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/mylyn/releases/3.10 . > > We'll need to do the following: > > 1) Create release branch for 3.10.x > 2) Request a mylyn-3.10.x-release job on Hudson > 3) Submit IP log for review > 4) Seek PMC approval for release (documentation) > 5) Schedule release review > 6) Create New and Noteworthy > 7) Tag and release
Steffen,
when do we create the "Mylyn 3.10.0 API Baseline"? Is this part of 2) or an separate step?

(In reply to comment #9) > > 7) Tag and release > > Steffen, > > when do we create the "Mylyn 3.10.0 API Baseline"? > Is this part of 2) or an separate step?
It happens as part of (7) http://wiki.eclipse.org/Mylyn/Release_Howto . I think we should revisit that though since the API baseline is essentially useless unless it resolves. I typically create it by using an Eclipse SDK and installing all of Mylyn into it.

(In reply to comment #8) > > 2) Request a mylyn-3.10.x-release job on Hudson > > Sam, Tomek, can you do that by filing a bug under Community/Hudson? Please ask > for a clone of the mylyn-release job so we can reuse the existing configuration.
Done: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=419623
> > 4) Seek PMC approval for release (documentation) > > Sam, can you please send an email to mylyn-pmc@eclipse.org to do that?
Done.
> > 6) Create New and Noteworthy > > Sam, Tomek, we should have that ready a few days before the release date. The > earlier the better so we can gather community feedback.
We'll try to do that for Nov. 1st.

I have retriggered the release build since the last one had bogus qualifiers ("null" instead of proper timestamps). I have remove the bogus build from the download area.
The RC build is now here: http://download.eclipse.org/mylyn/drops/3.10.0/v20131017-0909/ .

An updated release candidate build is now available for Mylyn 3.10: http://download.eclipse.org/mylyn/drops/3.10.0/v20131024-1957/
Please give it a spin. If no critical problems are found and the release review passes we will make the build available on the release site on November 6.
Sam, do we have a draft for the New & Noteworthy already?
No, I am going to work on this today.

Steffen, I've created a review:
18062: 409767: New & Noteworthy for Mylyn 3.10 [Iac540afa] https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/18062/
(I'm not a comitter on that repository so I can't submit it.)
The release is available from the main repository now. Thanks everyone for making this happen!
